questions.text: The 1973 Constitution came into force on:
questions.explanation: The 1973 Constitution was adopted on April 12, 1973, but came into force on August 14, 1973.

questions.text: Under which article of the 1973 Constitution is Urdu declared the national language?
questions.explanation: Article 251 of the 1973 Constitution declares Urdu as the national language of Pakistan.

questions.text: The Basic Democracies system was introduced by:
questions.explanation: The Basic Democracies system was introduced by Ayub Khan in 1959 as a form of local government.

questions.text: How many parts are there in the 1973 Constitution?
questions.explanation: The 1973 Constitution consists of 12 parts covering various aspects of governance.

questions.text: The 2nd Amendment to the Constitution (1974) declared which group as non-Muslims?
questions.explanation: The 2nd Amendment (1974) declared Ahmadis as non-Muslims for constitutional purposes.

questions.text: Which amendment gave President the power to dissolve National Assembly?
questions.explanation: The 8th Amendment (1985) gave the President power to dissolve the National Assembly.

questions.text: The minimum age for a member of National Assembly is:
questions.explanation: Article 62 of the Constitution requires a minimum age of 25 years for National Assembly membership.
President Iskander Mirza abrogated the 1956 Constitution on October 7, 1958, and declared martial law.

questions.text: The Senate of Pakistan has how many members?
questions.explanation: The Senate of Pakistan has 104 members representing the four provinces, federal capital, and tribal areas.

questions.text: The concurrent list was abolished by which constitutional amendment?
questions.explanation: The 18th Amendment (2010) abolished the concurrent list, giving more powers to provinces.
